trans-unit.source: Represents a selectable item inside a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Menu"></xref>.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedItemsControl>, which means its header and collection of objects can be of any type (such as string, image, or panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedItemsControl> class.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> can have submenus.
The submenu of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> is made up of the objects within the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem>.
It is common for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> to contain other <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> objects to create nested submenus.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> can have one of several functions:
It can be selected to invoke a command.
It can be a separator for other menu items.
It can be a header for a submenu.
It can be checked or unchecked.

By default, the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment%2A> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> is set to <xref:System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment?displayProperty=fullName>.
The default horizontal position of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StackPanel> is <xref:System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment?displayProperty=fullName>.

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Width%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> through a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StackPanel>, the stack panel's default is applied and the item is centered.

The<xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> handles the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseDown> event, so if you attach an event handler to <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseDown>, your handler will never be called.

To add your own handler, subscribe to the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.PreviewMouseDown> event or subscribe to <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseDown> by calling <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.AddHandler%28System.Windows.RoutedEvent%2CSystem.Delegate%2CSystem.Boolean%29> with `handledEventsToo` set to `true`.
Customizing the MenuItem Control
To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem>, see [Menu Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/menu-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the control’s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> class.
Occurs when a menu item is checked.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Checked"></xref> routed event.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is clicked.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Click> event does not occur if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> has a submenu.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Click"></xref> routed event.
This event corresponds to a left mouse button click.
Gets or sets the command associated with the menu item.
This property is used to associate a command with a particular <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> instance.
The following example associates the **Copy** command with a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> and automatically supplies the input gesture text **Ctrl+C**.

The example does not set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedItemsControl.Header%2A> property, but the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedItemsControl.Header%2A> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> is "Copy" at run time.
You can specify another header for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> if you want it to be different.
For information on how to bind to the desired command, see [Add a Command to a MenuItem](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/013d68a0-5373-4a68-bd91-5de574307370).
[!code-xml[MenuItems_snip#MenuItemCommand](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/MenuItems_snip/CSharp/Pane1.xaml#menuitemcommand)]
A command is raised when a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> is clicked—just after the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Click> event.
The command is raised on the element according to the following priorities:
If <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.CommandTarget%2A> is set on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem>, that element is used.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.PlacementTarget%2A> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu> that contains the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem>.
The focus target of the main window that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Menu>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> that was clicked.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The command associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets the parameter to pass to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Command"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The parameter to pass to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Command"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
The default is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.CommandParameter"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Command"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the target element on which to raise the specified command.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.CommandTarget%2A> property specifies the element where the command occurs.
If <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.CommandTarget%2A> is not set, the element that has keyboard focus will receive the command.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The element on which to raise the specified command.
The default is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.CommandTarget"></xref> dependency property.
Creates or identifies the element used to display a specified item.
The element used to display a specified item.
Gets whether the control supports scrolling.

If the control has a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> in its style and has a custom keyboard scrolling behavior, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.HandlesScrolling%2A> should return `true`.
`true` in all cases.
Gets or sets the icon that appears in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
Many <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Menu> controls have more than just text in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> elements.
Often there are icons, check marks, accelerators, and arrows to indicate submenus.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The icon that appears in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
The default value is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Icon"></xref> dependency property.
Sets the text describing an input gesture that will call the command tied to the specified item.
This property does not associate the input gesture with the menu item; it simply adds text to the menu item.
The application must handle the user's input to carry out the action.
For information on how to associate a command with a menu item, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Command%2A>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The text that describes the input gesture, such as **Ctrl+C** for the **Copy** command.
The default is an empty string ("").
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.InputGestureText"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> can be checked.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the menu item can be checked; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsCheckable"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is checked.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.BindsTwoWayByDefault%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Journal%2A>
`true` if a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is checked; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsChecked"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.IsEnabled"></xref> property is `true` for the current menu item.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> can be selected; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is highlighted.
Starting with the .NET Framework version 3.0 Service Pack 1, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsHighlighted%2A> property has a protected setter.
To use this functionality, your application should target the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [.NET Framework Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is highlighted; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsHighlighted"></xref> dependency property.
Determines if the specified item is (or is eligible to be) its own ItemContainer.
Specified item.
`true` if the item is its own ItemContainer; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is pressed.
Starting with the .NET Framework version 3.0 Service Pack 1, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsPressed%2A> property has a protected setter.
To use this functionality, your application should target the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [.NET Framework Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is pressed; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsPressed"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the submenu of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is open.
When <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsSubmenuOpen%2A> is set to `true`, mouse capture is set to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> and its subtree.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
`true` if the submenu of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is open; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsSubmenuOpen"></xref> dependency property.
Gets whether a menu suspends animations on its <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup"></xref> control.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the menu should suspend animations on its popup; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsSuspendingPopupAnimation"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the custom logic for choosing a template used to display each item.

Use an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerTemplateSelector> to choose different item containers if the items in your collection are the same type and you need to provide custom logic to choose the item container.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A custom object that provides logic and returns an item container.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.ItemContainerTemplateSelector"></xref> dependency property.
Responds when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AccessText.AccessKey"></xref> for this control is invoked.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.AccessKeyManager.AccessKeyPressed"></xref> event.
Called when the template's tree is generated.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsChecked"></xref> property becomes `true`.
This method raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Checked"></xref> routed event.
The control raises the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Checked> event by calling <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEvent%2A>.
For more information, see [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md).
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Checked"></xref> event.
Called when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is clicked and raises a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Click"></xref> event.
If you inherit from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem>, be sure to call the base class to get the following behavior.
Toggling of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsChecked%2A> property.
Focus being set to the menu item.
Automation invoke event.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Click> event.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] automation infrastructure.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
Announces that the keyboard is focused on this element.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.GotFocus"></xref> event.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.IsInitialized"></xref> property is set to `true` and raises an <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Initialized"></xref> event.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Initialized"></xref> event.
Called when the focus is no longer on or within a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithinChanged"></xref> event.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> property changes.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerGenerator.ItemsChanged"></xref> event.
Responds to the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> event.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> event.
Called whenever the mouse enters a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Mouse.MouseEnter"></xref> event.
Called whenever the mouse leaves a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Mouse.MouseLeave"></xref> event.
Called when the left mouse button is pressed.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonDown"></xref> event.
Called when the left mouse button is released.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonUp"></xref> event.
Called when the mouse is moved over a menu item.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Mouse.MouseMove"></xref> event.
Called when the right mouse button is pressed.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseRightButtonDown"></xref> event.
Called when the right mouse button is released.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseRightButtonUp"></xref> event.
Called when the submenu of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is closed.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.SubmenuClosed"></xref> event.
Called when the submenu of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is opened.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.SubmenuOpened"></xref> event.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsChecked"></xref> property becomes `false`.
This method raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Unchecked"></xref> routed event.
The control raises the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Unchecked> event by calling <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEvent%2A>.
For more information, see [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md).
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Unchecked"></xref> event.
Called when the parent of the visual <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> changes.
Old value of the parent of the visual, or null if the visual did not have a parent.
Prepares the specified element to display the specified item.
Preparing the element may involve applying styles, setting bindings, and so on.
Element used to display the specified item.
Specified item.
Gets a value that indicates the role of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
The value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Role%2A> depends on the relationship to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Menu> and other <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> objects.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItemRole"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItemRole.TopLevelItem"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Role"></xref> dependency property.

Gets the resource key for a style applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Separator"></xref>.
Use this property to change the style of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator> in a menu.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*={ **MenuItem.SeparatorStyleKey**}`"`/>

The resource key for a style applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Separator"></xref>.
Used to determine whether to apply a style to the item container.
Container to which the style will be applied.
Item to which the container belongs.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is not a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Separator"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates that the submenu in which this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is located should not close when this item is clicked.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the submenu in which this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is located should not close when this item is clicked; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.StaysOpenOnClick"></xref> dependency property.
Occurs when the state of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsSubmenuOpen"></xref> property changes to `false`.

Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.SubmenuClosed"></xref> routed event.
Gets the resource key for a style applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is a header of a submenu.

Use this property to change the style of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> whose <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Role%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItemRole?displayProperty=fullName>.

<*object* *property*={ **MenuItem.SubmenuHeaderTemplateKey**}`"`/>
The resource key for a style applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is a header of a submenu.
Gets the resource key for a style applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is a submenu.

Use this property to change the style of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> whose <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Role%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItemRole?displayProperty=fullName>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*={ **MenuItem.SubmenuItemTemplateKey**}`"`/>
The resource key for a style applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is a submenu.
Occurs when the state of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.IsSubmenuOpen"></xref> property changes to `true`.
Routed Event Information

Routing strategy
Bubbling

Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.SubmenuOpened"></xref> routed event.
Gets the resource key for a style applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is a header of a top-level menu.

Use this property to change the style of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> whose <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Role%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItemRole?displayProperty=fullName>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*={ **MenuItem.TopLevelHeaderTemplateKey**}`"`/>
The resource key for a style applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is a header of a top-level menu.

Gets the resource key for a style applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> when it is a top-level <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> that can invoke commands.

Use this property to change the style of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> whose <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Role%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItemRole?displayProperty=fullName>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*={ **MenuItem.TopLevelItemTemplateKey**}`"`/>
The resource key for a style applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> when it is a top-level <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> that can invoke commands.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> is unchecked.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.Unchecked"></xref> routed event.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the menu selects different item containers, depending on the type of the item in the underlying collection or some other heuristic.
This property is useful if you want to create a menu by binding to a collection.
The item container is the UI element that displays the object in a collection.

If you want to bind to a collection to create a menu that contains <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> objects and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator> objects, set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MenuBase.UsesItemContainerTemplate%2A> property to true and create an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerTemplate> for each type of object in your collection.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerTemplate> must contain either a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> or a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` the menu selects different item containers; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.UsesItemContainerTemplate"></xref> dependency property.
